author: rivals.com
title: THE WEST ZONE message board | SHOP NOW: DEALS on CLEMSON app
text:
Memorial Stadium has come such a long way in recent years, starting with the first-phase construction of the West End Zone and culminating the past two years with the completion of that project, and the much-needed revitalization of the luxury boxes and club seating.
The stadium has always been a wonderful place to visit. Dating to the completion of the north upper deck in the early 1980s, it has been among the crown jewels of college football stadiums. The on-campus setting, and the letters in the upper deck and all those Tigers paws just make it one of the great places to watch a game.
But boy, had it become dated in a number of important ways. So credit to Terry Don Phillips for the West End Zone vision and execution, and credit to Dan Radakovich for the more recent modernization. The place has so much pop now, particularly for night games.
AP
